Job Location: New York City, New York; Los Angeles, California
Job Title: Private Funds Mid-Level Associate (NY or LA)
Job Description:
Paul Hastings is seeking 2nd-8th year associates to join the Investment Funds & Private Capital team. This position may reside in New York or Los Angeles, and candidates must have experience in private equity funds, advising clients on all aspects of fund formation, fund structuring and capital raising. 

Outstanding academic credentials and law firm experience are required, and candidates must also be admitted to practice law and in good standing in the jurisdiction where they are hired. Please submit a cover letter, resume, law school transcript, and deal sheet. 

The salary wage range that we expect to pay for this position is a minimum of $235,000 and a maximum of $435,000 (annually). The actual pay wage may vary based on experience or other relevant factors.

ABOUT PAUL HASTINGS
With widely recognized elite teams in finance, mergers & acquisitions, private equity, restructuring and special situations, litigation, employment and real estate, Paul Hastings is a premier law firm providing intellectual capital and superior execution globally to the world’s leading investment banks, asset managers, and corporations. 

NOTE TO SEARCH FIRMS: Applications must be submitted through our online search firm portal. Any materials sent outside of the portal, or directly to our attorneys, will not be accepted. If you do not have a search firm ID code or a fee agreement, please send a detailed blind profile of your candidate to careeropportunities@paulhastings.com.

_Paul Hastings LLP is an equal opportunity employer. _
Specialty: Investment Funds, Private Equity, Fund Formation

Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

Help make the American dream come true for immigrants! This is an exciting opportunity to grow your career with one of the largest law firms in the United States. Ogletree Deakins is an international law firm with 60 offices throughout North America and Europe. We have one of the largest business immigration practices in the United States; our immigration practice group consists of experienced and dedicated immigration lawyers and paralegals who work with domestic and international corporations and businesses in developing appropriate strategies to facilitate the international transfer of skilled employees.

Our Washington D.C. office has an opportunity for an experienced Business Immigration Paralegal to join their fast-paced business immigration practice! Under attorney supervision, the immigration paralegal is responsible for the preparation and filing of petitions and visa applications. The paralegal compiles and analyzes case facts, drafts correspondence, maintains and organizes client documentation, and communicates directly with multiple attorneys.

We offer a collegial, collaborative, challenging, and growth-focused work environment with innovative technology, customized resources and processes, and continuous skill-based training and professional development.

This is not a remote opportunity. Candidates must be willing to work from our DC office with opportunity for hybrid work schedule after 3-6 months.

REQUIREMENTS 

 	* Degree from accredited college or university OR paralegal certification is required
 	* Minimum of 2 years of experience as a business immigration paralegal
 	* Knowledge of Non-Immigrant Visa (NIV) and Immigrant Visa (IV) processes
 	* Successful candidates will possess strong writing skills, have excellent attention to detail, be able to multi-task, and work independently toward team goals.
 	* Outstanding organizational skills are required.
 	* Be able to multi-task and work independently toward team goals.
 	* Strong proficiency with MS Word, Outlook, INSZoom, and document management systems.

_Please note, we are not working with outside recruiters for this position._

BENEFITS 

_In accordance with the Wage Transparency Omnibus Amendment Act, the expected salary range for this DC position is between $63,680 and $95,520._ _This position qualifies for the benefits below. _

Ogletree Deakins offers a robust suite of benefits for our Staff including: Paid Time Off, Paid Sick Leave, a 401(k) matching program, Profit Sharing, Paid Holidays, Paid Parental Leave, affordable Health and Life Insurance including Dental & Vision coverage, Health Savings Account /Flexible Spending Accounts to help offset the cost of dependent care and/or health care expenses, Tuition Reimbursement and an Employee Assistance Program.

CONTACT INFORMATION 

If you have questions, please e-mail Jess Lindsey at jess.lindsey@ogletree.com with “Business Immigration Paralegal II - Washington" in the subject line. Please note, applications submitted via e-mail will not be considered.

FIRM OVERVIEW 

_Ogletree Deakins has one of the largest Business Immigration practices in the United States and provides a wide range of legal services for employers seeking temporary business visas and permanent residence on behalf of foreign national employees. We provide comprehensive immigration services to clients of all sizes, including numerous Fortune 500 companies. Our practice is designed to provide superior client service at competitive fixed fee rates. Our attorneys are proactive in handling client matters, from case initiation to case strategy/planning to the successful completion of the case, always remaining accessible to all of our clients._

_We are fully committed to the importance of diversity within the legal profession, as well as all workplace environments and strongly encourage the interest of diverse candidates in the firm._

_Equal Opportunity Employer._

DON’T SEE THE RIGHT OPPORTUNITY YET?
_Join our Talent Community [https://careers.ogletree.com/od-talent/talentcommunity/form] to receive updates on future job openings, events and career news._

Description
The growing Boston office of Cozen O’Connor is seeking an experienced litigation paralegal to support the attorneys in the Global Insurance Department. The candidate should have strong communication, organizational and interpersonal skills, experience handling complex matters involving catastrophic injuries, and the ability to prioritize and balance a variety of tasks. An ideal candidate would have exposure assessing medical records and detailed construction records relative to defect litigation as well. The ideal candidate has 3-5+ years of litigation experience and thrives in a fast-paced, high intensity environment. While we are busy, we pride ourselves on being team-oriented and working collectively to our client’s best interests. The candidate will be expected to work flexible hours and overtime as needed. The candidate may also support the Labor and Employment and Construction Law attorneys in the office as needed as well.

We are not accepting resumes from search firms. 

Qualifications 

 	* A minimum of 3 years of experience in a legal environment 3+ is highly preferred.
 	* A four-year college degree and/or paralegal certificate required.
 	* Ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
 	* Strong interpersonal skills to build a rapport with team and clients.
 	* Detail oriented, able to work independently, and possess excellent organizational and written/oral communication skills.
 	* Must have the motivation and skill to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
 	* Proven computer/technology skills. Microsoft Office Suite a must.

 Responsibilities 

 	* Assist attorneys in with all aspects of trial preparation. 
 	* Assist in preparing legal documents including motions, contracts, and agreements.
 	* Oversee/assist with the discovery process, including the analysis of medical records obtaining IME’s, scheduling depositions, assisting with discovery requests and responses, and preparing /filing pleadings, privilege logs and memoranda.
 	* Establish and maintain strong communications with clients, experts, witnesses, etc. 
 	* Perform factual research and investigation addressing various trial issues
 	* Utilize computer databases to organize, store and access information; conduct moderately complex research on LEXIS, Westlaw and other online computer assisted research databases.
 	* Trial preparation and attendance at trial (organizing evidence, preparing exhibits, scheduling witnesses, ensuring that witnesses are ready when needed). 
 	* Keep apprised of all developments of E-discovery, including the technical aspects of collecting, reviewing, and producing electronically stored information (state and federal court). 
 	* Proficiency in PACER, Relativity, Billing Software, case management software, Adobe Acrobat, and Trial Director preferred.
Specialty: Insurance, Litigation, Personal Injury, Construction, Labor & Employment

Job Description:
Position: Finance Attorney (Senior Associate) – ABF/Structured Finance
Office: New York, NY
Experience: 5+ Years of Experience

WHO WE ARE

MoFo is a destination law firm for talented, ambitious attorneys who value collaboration, teamwork, and commitment to excellence. We are known around the world not only for delivering innovative yet practical client service but also for serving as an incubator for our top-notch talent.

MoFo consistently receives top-tier rankings from leading directories and publications, speaking to our legal capabilities, dedication to creating an inclusive workplace, and commitment to our communities.

OUR FINANCE PRACTICE GROUP

As a co-chair of the Finance practice group and hiring partner for this position, Dario Avram [https://www.mofo.com/people/dario-avram] states "associates in the Finance group have the opportunity to work on complex and fast paced financing transactions, together with a diverse group of smart and collaborative colleagues." Learn more about the team and the work you can do at https://www.mofo.com/capabilities/lending-financial-transactions [https://www.mofo.com/capabilities/lending-financial-transactions].

WHO YOU ARE

The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience representing issuers, investors and/or back leverage providers in asset based/structured finance transactions. Principal experience must include warehouse lending facilities, forward flow transactions, whole loan transfers and repurchase agreements, in addition to securitization or securitization-related matters. 

 	* You are experienced in managing components of transactions independently.
 	* You are a highly-motivated and proactive team player with a results-oriented work ethic, strong interpersonal skills and demonstrable client relationship skills.
 	* You have experience managing associate teams and are a good communicator looking to work in a collaborative practice that features a lot of client-facing opportunities.
 	* You are a member of the State Bar of New York.
 	* Strong academic credentials and strong prior Big Law work experience required.

OWN YOUR MOFO CAREER

MoFo empowers its lawyers at every level to take ownership of their careers and is transparent about what it takes to succeed and advance at the firm. The firm’s commitment to our attorneys’ growth extends throughout their careers.

 	* MYMOFO, a best-in-class and transparent framework for success, provides associates with clear and consistent expectations at every experience level.
 	* MOFO NAVIGATE, our mentoring and sponsorship programs, takes a holistic approach to professional growth. By encouraging collaboration and leveraging insight across departments and geography, and over the course of each attorney’s career, MoFo Navigate creates a support system dynamic enough to respond to the changing needs of all of our attorneys as they grow and develop.
 	* MOFO NEXT, our dedicated Center for Career Advancement, offers services such as career visioning, crafting communication materials, executive presence resources, interview techniques, and networking skills.

WHAT WE OFFER

 	* A variety of options for medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverage to meet the needs of you and your family.
 	* Industry-leading parental leave and family benefits including adoption and fertility treatment options, backup child and elder care, and more.
 	* Tax free health accounts: HSA and FSA.
 	* 401(k) or Roth 401(k) plans.
 	* Global wellness program, including free access to health care advocates, Employee Assistance Program, Talkspace, and Calm apps.
 	* Flex Time Away and reduced schedule arrangements.
 	* Paid annual fees for primary state bar registration, and up to two professional associations. Additional bar memberships may be approved on a case-by-case basis. 
 	* Dedicated in-house pro bono counsel to assist with identifying pro bono organizations and matters to work with.
 	* Matching gift programs for law school and charitable organization donations.

INQUIRIES

For questions regarding this position, please contact Onika McDonnell, Sr. Attorney Recruiting Specialist.

_Morrison Foerster accepts applications for this position on an ongoing basis, until filled._

_Where required by law, salary ranges are stated below. Additional compensation may include a discretionary bonus, health/welfare benefits (including parental, adoption, and fertility benefits), flexible time off, and paid holidays. The range displayed is specifically for positions performed in those cities/states and may vary based on factors including but not limited to the following: market data and ranges; an applicant’s skills and prior relevant experience (including class year); and certain degrees, licensing, and certifications._

_New York, NY annual salary range: $390,000 to $435,000_

Job Title: New York Public Companies & Capital Markets Associate
Job Description:
We are seeking a corporate [https://careers.wsgr.com/practice/corporate/general-corporate/] associate with 2-4 years of law firm experience in capital markets and public company work.

Candidates should have experience representing either issuers or investment banks in capital markets transactions, including IPOs, equity/debt offerings, private investment in public entities (PIPEs) and at-the-market offerings. Candidates should also have experience in public company reporting compliance and governance and the day-to-day issues that arise for public companies, such as SEC compliance, disclosure, matters, governance, and Nasdaq/NYSE compliance.

Superior academic credentials, excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills required.

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS 

 	* Salary range of $235,000 – $310,000, based on year classification.
 	* Discretionary merit bonuses may also be awarded.

	* Our benefits include: 

 	* Monthly wellness reimbursements
 	* 24/7 emotional and behavioral health support and virtual counseling
 	* Healthcare coverage for you and your same- or opposite-sex spouse/domestic partner and children up to age 26
 	* Family-building benefits including IVF, adoption, surrogacy, and egg-freezing
 	* Paid parental leave
 	* Parenting support concierge and telemedicine
 	* Parents and caregivers resource group
 	* Career coaching for working parents
 	* In-home and center-based back-up childcare
 	* Tutoring and college coach for older children
 	* Health Savings Accounts with firm contribution
 	* Flexible spending accounts
 	* 401(k) retirement plan
 	* Pretax commuter and parking benefits
 	* Basic and supplemental life insurance
 	* Short and long-term disability
 	* Voluntary long term care insurance
 	* Voluntary critical illness, hospitalization, and accident insurance
 	* Voluntary ID theft protection
 	* Voluntary pet insurance
 	* Medicare consulting
 	* Firm-paid CLE, bar review fees, and bar dues
Specialty: Capital Markets, Public Company, IPOs, Securities, Compliance/Regulatory

Job Description:
Goodwin Procter seeks a Science Advisor/Patent Agent to join our Life Sciences Business Unit and Intellectual Property Transactions & Strategies Group. This is an exciting opportunity for candidates with a deep scientific background and a passion for innovation, who are looking to apply their expertise in a dynamic legal environment supporting cutting-edge clients in the life sciences sector.

Preferred candidates will have demonstrated interest and/or experience in the following:

 	* Drafting patent applications, including preparing detailed specifications and claims in coordination with inventors and in house counsel.
 	* Performing comprehensive prior art searches and freedom-to-operate (FTO) analyses to support product development and risk mitigation strategies.
 	* Assessing scientific inventions and complex technologies to evaluate patentability, validity, and potential infringement risks.
 	* Supporting IP due diligence efforts in connection with mergers, acquisitions, investments, and licensing transactions.
 	* Conducting IP landscape and competitive intelligence analyses to inform client R&D, IP strategy, and business planning.
 	* Advising clients on patent portfolio development and management, including prosecution strategies and global filing approaches.
 	* Managing the day-to-day needs of a clients’ patent portfolio, including by preparing responses to offices actions under the supervision of senior science advisors/associates in coordination with in house counsel.
 	* Collaborating closely with attorneys and clients to align IP strategies with business objectives.

Candidates applying for this position should have:

 	* Strong academic credentials and demonstrated technical writing and communication skills. 
 	* Familiarity with U.S. and international patent law principles, particularly in the life sciences and biotech domains.
 	* Eligible to sit for the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registration examination if not already registered.

Preferred Qualifications:

 	* M.D., Ph.D., or equivalent advanced degree in Chemistry.
 	* Prior law firm or in-house IP experience, particularly involving patent preparation and prosecution.
 	* Admission to practice before the USPTO is strongly preferred.
 	* A proactive, detail-oriented approach with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Target Salary Range: $145,000 - $155,000

Job Title: Real Estate Transactional and Environmental Counsel/Associate
Job Description:
Real Estate Transactional and Environmental Counsel Corporate & Capital Markets 

Brown Rudnick is seeking a qualified attorney with at least 10 years of experience practicing environmental and real estate law to join its Real Estate, Energy & Environmental Practice Group for a part-time Counsel-level role in the Boston, MA office. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Massachusetts environmental law and a strong track record advising clients on land use, zoning, and regulatory permitting matters. The ability to navigate complex local and state permitting processes and to provide strategic counsel on regulatory compliance is essential. Candidates should also have experience counseling clients on environmental risks and liabilities in the context of real estate and business transactions. A background that includes work related to RCRA, CERCLA, and agency enforcement actions is particularly valuable. In addition to core environmental experience, candidates with a general real estate transactional background and familiarity with construction law will be well suited for this role. Experience with acquisitions, dispositions, leasing, or development agreements will be considered a plus.

This position offers a flexible schedule and is open to a professional track attorney seeking a part-time, hourly paid, arrangement.

 	* Candidates must have outstanding academic credentials, comparable law firm or other experience, and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 	* Comparable law firm experience required; clerkship experience preferred.
 	* JD required
 	* Admission to the Massachusetts Bar

Jones Day is seeking a mid-level associate to join the Antitrust & Competition Law Practice in the Washington DC office. Qualified applicants should have three to six years of transactional antitrust experience (private firm or government agency), including HSR, deal counseling, and merger investigations before the FTC, DOJ, and other enforcement agencies. Experience with other substantive areas like antitrust investigations (FTC/DOJ/State AG), complex litigations (particularly federal), and client counseling is also strongly desired. Experience with technology industries, pharmaceuticals, health care, and retail is desirable but not a prerequisite. Applicants must be able to demonstrate strong research, writing, and analytic skills; an ability to work independently and creatively; an ability to multi-task across matters; an ability to work successfully as part of a team and assume significant responsibilities; and should possess excellent academic credentials.

Applicants must currently be licensed, or currently be eligible to become licensed, to practice law in the jurisdiction(s) where they apply. To be considered, please provide a cover letter, resume, and law school transcript. 

The salary range for this role is $260,000 - $495,000. Actual salary will be commensurate with the candidate’s qualifications and relevant experience.

Job Description:
We are seeking associates in law school class years 2022 and above to join our prestigious and growing tax team. In addition to class-year appropriate understanding of technical aspects of tax law (including research abilities), candidates should have experience with (and a keen interest in) real estate matters (including REITs). They must also have outstanding writing, oral communication, and analytical skills, as well as top academic credentials and an ability and desire to think creatively about interesting, difficult and often novel problems.

The annual compensation range for this position is between $260,000 and $420,000. The salary offered within this range will depend upon qualifications and other operational considerations. Benefits offered for this position include health care; retirement benefits; paid days off, including sick time, and vacation time; parental leave; basic life insurance; Flexible Spending Accounts; as well as discretionary, performance-based bonuses.

We are seeking associates in law school class years 2019 to 2022 to join our prestigious and growing tax practice. In addition to class-year appropriate understanding of technical aspects of tax law (including research and writing abilities), candidates should have experience with strategic and private equity M&A transactions, capital markets (including spin-offs and IPOs), investment fund formation, and/or real estate matters. Candidates also must have outstanding oral communication and analytical skills, as well as top academic credentials and an ability (and desire) to think creatively about interesting, difficult, and often novel problems. The tax group places particular emphasis on interpersonal skills; candidates should be enthusiastic about interacting directly with clients, getting involved with public speaking (including at large national tax conferences), and making the most of in-office time by meeting face-to-face with colleagues.

The annual compensation range for this position is between $260,000 and $390,000. The salary offered within this range will depend upon qualifications and other operational considerations. Benefits offered for this position include health care; retirement benefits; paid days off, including sick time, and vacation time; parental leave; basic life insurance; Flexible Spending Accounts; as well as discretionary, performance-based bonuses.

Job Location: Baltimore, Maryland; District of Columbia; Chicago, Illinois; Denver, Colorado; Miami, Florida; New York City, New York
Job Description: Venable LLP’s Corporate Group seeks a mid-level finance associate with four to six years of financial transactions experience to join our finance and lending team in the Baltimore, Chicago, Denver, Miami, New York, or Washington, D.C. offices. The qualified candidate has substantial law firm experience representing both borrowers and lenders, including banks, direct lenders, private credit funds, and corporate borrowers, across a wide range of complex financing transactions, including but not limited to fund finance, asset-based financing, corporate financings, and secured transactions. The associate will be working on matters such as capital-call facilities, NAV facilities, hybrids, warehouse facilities, management-fee lines of credit, secured lending, leveraged buyouts, acquisition financings, syndicated and bilateral credit facilities, asset-based loans, bridge and mezzanine financings, and refinancing and recapitalization transactions. Experience working with private funds, multi-tranche capital structures, secured and unsecured facilities, and intercreditor arrangements is required. The candidate should be comfortable leading and managing the transaction from inception to end and should be able to train and manage junior associates. Representative tasks to be performed by the successful candidate include, but are not limited to: Drafting, reviewing, and negotiating commitment letters, term sheets, loan agreements, security agreements, intercreditor agreements, repurchase agreements, and related documentation. Supporting counsel and partners with deal management and proactively progressing tasks to get the transaction to closing. Managing and conducting due-diligence, issues lists, diligence summaries, and transaction checklists. Serving as a primary point of contact for clients, opposing counsel, junior associates, paralegals, and internal cross-practice deal teams. Advising clients on post-closing matters including post-closing conditions, joinders, amendments, waivers, interpretive issues, and collateral concerns, among others. Conducting legal research and supporting senior attorneys on a range of domestic and cross-border financing and restructuring matters. Participating in client education initiatives and business development presentations. Providing mentorship to junior associates and participating in firm citizenship activities. The successful candidate has excellent oral and written communication skills, with a particular focus on strong drafting skills, and outstanding academic credentials. Candidates must have a juris doctorate degree from an accredited law school and be admitted to and in good standing with the relevant local Bar. Please include law school transcript and a deal sheet with submissions. Venable LLP is an American Lawyer Global 100 law firm headquartered in Washington, DC, with offices in California, Colorado, Delaware, Florida, Illinois, Maryland, New York, and Virginia. Our lawyers and legislative advisors serve domestic and international clients in all areas of corporate and business law, complex litigation, intellectual property, regulatory matters, and government affairs. Additional information can be found at Venable.com. The salary range for associate positions is $215,000 to $355,000. The actual salary offered will be based on several job-related factors including, but not limited to, years of related experience, level of education, skills, credentials and certifications, responsibilities, and performance. Venable LLP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, protected Veteran status, and any other protected basis under applicable law. Contact: Melissa Meyer Senior Director of Associate Recruitment MNMeyer@Venable.com
Specialty: Lending, Secured Finance, Finance, Leveraged Finance, Acquisition Finance, Mezzanine Finance

Job Location: Los Angeles, California; New York City, New York
Job Title: Paralegal - Restructuring, Insolvency and Bankruptcy - Los Angeles or New York
Job Description: Culture and Engagement at Dentons Fostering an inclusive and welcoming culture is a core priority at Dentons. We are committed to creating an environment that values and respects the contributions of all colleagues. By attracting, supporting, promoting and retaining highly qualified individuals of various backgrounds and experiences, we strengthen our ability to provide innovative solutions, deliver exceptional client service, and advance the success of our Firm. Dentons takes an active approach to promoting a collaborative and inclusive workplace by investing in professional development and culture initiatives. Responsibilities Dentons US LLP is currently recruiting for a full-time Restructuring, Insolvency and Bankruptcy Paralegal to be based in our Los Angeles or New York office. This position will support the local Restructuring Insolvency and Bankruptcy Practitioners and the national Restructuring Insolvency and Bankruptcy Practice Group. This position will report to the Practice Group Leader, with daily work performed primarily under the direction of assigned practice group lawyers and/or paraprofessionals. Expected responsibilities will include: Prepare Fee Applications (monthly, interim, final), documents, and materials for use at Court hearings and other bankruptcy specific documents Provide support on lien searches and analyses and schedules and statement of financial affairs Prepare Proofs of Claim and reconciliation of claims filed (proof of claims; scheduled of claims) Exhibit understanding of Statutory and Case Deadlines and prepare related memos Demonstrate understanding of Local Rules within each Jurisdiction Work closely with clients and financial advisors and prepare monthly operating reports Prepare ballot packages (tabulate and certify ballot classes; prepare charts; prepare ballot tally reports) Other tasks as assigned or required Pursuant with California and New York laws, the salary range for this position in Los Angeles and New York is $102,000 to $145,000, based on experience. Dentons offers a competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, profit sharing, short-term/long-term disability, life insurance, tuition reimbursement, paid time off, paid holidays and discretionary bonuses. Position qualifications Attainment of at least a Bachelor’s Degree is required 4 to 10 years bankruptcy experience Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and an ability to prioritize and complete simultaneous projects with minimal supervision are essential Must have superior client service and communication skills Must have the ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure Must have the ability to interact and work productively with all levels of lawyers, paraprofessionals and business services team members Must demonstrate strong verbal, written, analytical, organizational and interpersonal skills Ability to maintain discretion and privacy with confidential matters and documents Ability to recognize and comprehend facts and legal concepts Strong computer technical skills and demonstrated ability to learn new technologies Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, PDF creation tool(s), document management software and Elite or other timekeeping software is required Ability to work overtime as needed Equal Opportunities Dentons US LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Disability/Vet. Pursuant to local ordinances, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Job Description: 

Cooley’s Cyber/Data/Privacy (c/d/p) practice group is seeking a midlevel associate who focuses on litigation and/or regulatory enforcement investigations involving privacy and data security matters to join the team in our New York, San Francisco, Chicago, or Washington, DC offices. Cooley’s diverse c/d/p group has over 30 full-time attorneys in the US, UK, Europe, and Asia. The firm continues to expand its award-winning c/d/p litigation and investigations practice.

Ideal applicants will have 4-6 years of experience focusing on regulatory investigations or litigation involving consumer protection issues (State AG, FTC, and other regulatory agencies), and/or be well-versed in defending data privacy and security class actions (e.g., Stored Communications Act, wiretapping claims, claims involving allegedly unfair and deceptive trade practices, and data breach class actions). Job Location: Los Angeles, California; New York City, New York
Job Title: Structured Finance Career Associate - NY or LA
Job Description: Responsibilities Orrick’s Structured Finance team is seeking an associate with 4-7 years of experience with a preference to join as a Career Associate. We are looking for a dedicated team player who thrives in managing multiple deals within a fast-paced environment and is eager to contribute to a collegial group. Orrick’s U.S. Structured Finance group advises on the industry’s most innovative transactions and significant regulatory reform measures. Our team is a structured finance powerhouse, adept at taking bespoke approaches to the structuring, execution, and selling of residential mortgage-backed, commercial mortgage-backed, and asset-backed securities, including esoteric ABS, as well as CLOs, repackagings, re-securitizations, and other financings. Our Career Associate program offers top legal talent an alternative to the partner track while still providing opportunities to do cutting-edge legal work. Lawyers join us as Career Associates at many stages, from recent graduates and participants in our Career Associate summer program, to more senior lawyers who join after practicing in other settings. These are rewarding roles if you share our passion for practicing law and delivering excellent service but seek a less intense total time commitment. To learn more about Orrick’s innovative Career Associate program, please visit: https://www.orrick.com/en/Careers/Lawyer-Job-Opportunities/Joining-as-a-career-associate. We are focused on finding an associate that would be located in New York or Los Angeles but are open to other locations. Membership to the State Bar of the desired location is required. Qualifications Four to seven years of relevant law firm experience. Candidates must be highly motivated and have superior client service skills. Must be a member of the Bar in a U.S. State and satisfy any requirements of the Orrick office’s jurisdiction. How to Apply: Please apply online at https://www.orrick.com/Careers and include a resume, J.D. transcript, and cover letter. Search firm recruiters must submit using our Search Firm Portal. Please contact recruiting@orrick.com for agreements and login credentials. If you have any questions, please reach out to Cassandra Gomez, Recruiting Manager at cgomez@orrick.com. Why Orrick: At our core, we value collegiality among our lawyers and strive to make our practices both professionally and personally rewarding. We’ll help you to connect with peers and mentors to ensure you are integrated into our client teams. Our top-notch training and mentoring programs, retreats and academies, and shadowing opportunities are what set us apart. If you are passionate about innovative work in a dynamic environment, you’re just who we’ve been looking for. Compensation and Benefits The expected salary range for this position is between $150,000 and $234,000. Orrick is committed to providing a comprehensive, competitive, and thoughtful total compensation package to our attorneys and staff, wherever they work. This compensation and benefits information is based on the Orrick’s estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors that may include, but not limited to, qualifications, relevant experience or education, particular skills or expertise, geography. Other compensation may include an annual discretionary merit bonus, which would be determined by Firm and individual performance. We offer a full range of elective health benefits including medical, dental, vision and life; robust mental well-being programs; child, family, elder, and pet care benefits; short- and long-term disability and industry leading parental leave benefits; health savings account contributions (w/applicable medical plan), flexible spending accounts, and a 401K program. This role will receive compensated time off through our Flexible Time Off program and paid holidays. Orrick accepts applications for this position on an ongoing basis, until filled. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Consistent with the SF Fair Chance Ordinance, an arrest and conviction record will not automatically disqualify a qualified applicant from consideration for employment. For attorney positions, a ’qualified applicant’ is an individual who is a member of the State Bar of California, admitted in good standing, and is eligible to practice[1]; or whose admission to the State Bar of California and eligibility to practice remains subject only to successful completion of the California Bar Examination. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for the position in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring. #LI-DNI

Job Title: Fund Finance Associate Attorney (Junior to Mid-Level)
Job Description: Position: Fund Finance Associate Attorney (Junior to Mid-Level) Office: Boston, MA Experience: 2 - 3 Years of Experience Who We Are MoFo is a destination law firm for talented, ambitious attorneys who value collaboration, teamwork, and commitment to excellence. We are known around the world not only for delivering innovative yet practical client service but also for serving as an incubator for our top-notch talent. MoFo consistently receives top-tier rankings from leading directories and publications, speaking to our legal capabilities, dedication to creating an inclusive workplace, and commitment to our communities. Our Fund Finance Team The hiring partners for this position, Joe O’Donnell and Maria Strickland, describe their team as a dynamic, collaborative group that focuses on training and mentorship to provide the highest quality client service and create a supportive environment for its team members. All team members have the opportunity to forge direct relationships with clients early in their careers, which they can continue to build on over the years. Our team represents a variety of banks and other financial institutions in single-lender and syndicated financing transactions lending to foreign and domestic private equity and venture capital funds, management companies, general partners and portfolio companies. Learn more about the team and the work you can do at https://www.mofo.com/capabilities/lending-financial-transactions. Who You Are The ideal candidate will have: You have 2 to 3 years experience working on debt finance transactions. You have experience with lender-side representation and experience with private equity and venture capital funds (preferred but not required). You have experience drafting and negotiating loan documents and reviewing diligence items in connection with debt finance transactions. You have a familiarity with limited partnership agreements and possibly private equity and venture capital fund structures. You have a proven track-record of working in a fast-paced environment and handling multiple transactions simultaneously. You have an ability to concisely and effectively communicate complex matters in oral and written form. You have a strong attention to detail and process-oriented mindset. You are an independent thinker that demonstrates commitment to client service. You desire to work in a team environment and take on increasing levels of responsibility You are a member of the Massachusetts bar. Own Your MoFo Career MoFo empowers its lawyers at every level to take ownership of their careers and is transparent about what it takes to succeed and advance at the firm. The firm’s commitment to our attorneys’ growth extends throughout their careers. MyMoFo, a best-in-class and transparent framework for success, provides associates with clear and consistent expectations at every experience level. MoFo Navigate, our mentoring and sponsorship programs, takes a holistic approach to professional growth. By encouraging collaboration and leveraging insight across departments and geography, and over the course of each attorney’s career, MoFo Navigate creates a support system dynamic enough to respond to the changing needs of all of our attorneys as they grow and develop. MoFo NEXT, our dedicated Center for Career Advancement, offers services such as career visioning, crafting communication materials, executive presence resources, interview techniques, and networking skills. Industry-leading parental leave and family benefits including adoption and fertility treatment options, backup child and elder care, and more. Job Description: Austin, Texas Job Description Pillsbury’s Tax Business Unit is seeking a high-performing associate with 2-3 years of experience to join its nationally recognized Executive Compensation & Benefits Practice Group. This role offers flexibility in location, with opportunities to be based in Austin, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, or Silicon Valley. Please indicate your preferred office location in your cover letter. The ideal candidate will have experience advising public and private employers, including start-ups, on a broad range of executive compensation and benefits matters, with particular emphasis on mergers and acquisitions, including Section 280G analysis, financings and initial public offerings, executive hires and terminations, stock compensation plans and award agreements, nonqualified deferred compensation (Section 409A), ERISA and group benefits compliance, and public company reporting and disclosure obligations. We are seeking an associate who exercises sound judgment, delivers consistently excellent work product, and builds trusted professional relationships. A proactive approach, attention to detail, and a strong commitment to client service are essential to success in this role. Responsibilities include: Collaborate with attorneys across offices to deliver exceptional client service in a fast-paced environment. Communicate clearly and effectively – both orally and in writing – with clients on highly sophisticated and complex matters. Demonstrate flexibility and initiative, including the ability to manage competing priorities and meet deadlines. Qualifications include: Juris Doctor (J.D.) or foreign equivalent; an LL.M. will be considered in lieu of a J.D. Prior or current experience at an Am Law 100 firm. Excellent academic credentials. Strong analytical, research, and legal writing skills. Exceptional interpersonal and communication abilities. Thorough understanding of professional ethics and conduct standards. Admission to, and good standing with, the bar in the jurisdiction(s) where you will practice. Pillsbury is home to one of the largest and most accomplished stand-alone executive compensation and benefits practices in the country. Recognized nationally and internationally, our team advises leading private, public, not-for-profit, and governmental clients on some of their most significant and ground-breaking executive compensation and benefits transactions and disputes. We also represent executives in high-profile employment and exit arrangements. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the California Fair Chance Act. California Pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on skillset and experience, is $235k - $260k. Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer. If you require an accommodation in order to apply for a position, please contact us at PillsburyWorkday@pillsburylaw.com.

The New York, NY office of Lewis Brisbois, a full-service AmLaw 100 firm, is actively seeking an associate attorney for our New York Labor Law Practice. The ideal candidate must be admitted to the New York Bar and will have at least one (1) to seven (7) years of experience defending construction accident cases alleging violations of New York Labor Law §§ 200, 240, and 241. The attorneys in Lewis Brisbois’ New York Labor Law Practice offer clients the benefit of extensive experience and vast resources developed as a result of defending these construction matters over several decades. We maintain a diverse client base that includes owners and developers of residential buildings, commercial buildings, and sports complexes, as well as municipalities, contractors, construction managers, insurers, and brokers. With deep and varied experience in the New York Labor Law arena, our lawyers advise clients on effective techniques for defending catastrophic injury claims that arise from serious construction accidents. Qualified candidates will be comfortable drafting and responding to discovery and initial pleadings, drafting, and arguing motions, as well as taking and defending depositions. Candidates must have strong writing and analytical skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment. The successful candidate will be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team. We offer competitive compensation and in addition, Lewis Brisbois offers a range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401k with employer match. Job Title: Structured Finance Associate - NY or LA
Job Description: Responsibilities Orrick’s Structured Finance team is seeking a hardworking associate with 4-7 years of transactional or finance experience for our Los Angeles or New York office. We are looking for a dedicated team player who thrives in managing multiple deals within a fast-paced environment and is eager to contribute to a collegial group. Orrick’s U.S. Structured Finance group advises on the industry’s most innovative transactions and significant regulatory reform measures. Our team is a structured finance powerhouse, adept at taking bespoke approaches to the structuring, execution, and selling of residential mortgage-backed, commercial mortgage-backed, and asset-backed securities, including esoteric ABS, as well as CLOs, repackagings, re-securitizations, and other financings. We are focused on finding an associate that would be located in New York or Los Angeles. Membership to the State Bar of the desired location is required. Qualifications Four to seven years of relevant law firm experience. Candidates must be highly motivated and have superior client service skills. Must be a member of the Bar in a U.S. State and satisfy any requirements of the Orrick office’s jurisdiction. How to Apply: Please apply online at https://www.orrick.com/Careers and include a resume, J.D. transcript, and cover letter. Search firm recruiters must submit using our Search Firm Portal. Please contact recruiting@orrick.com for agreements and login credentials. If you have any questions, please reach out to Cassie Gomez, Recruiting Manager, at cgomez@orrick.com. Why Orrick: At our core, we value collegiality among our lawyers and strive to make our practices both professionally and personally rewarding. We’ll help you to connect with peers and mentors to ensure you are integrated into our client teams. Our top-notch training and mentoring programs, retreats and academies, and shadowing opportunities are what set us apart. If you are passionate about innovative work in a dynamic environment, you’re just who we’ve been looking for. Compensation and Benefits The expected salary range for this position is between $310,000 and $420,000. Orrick is committed to providing a comprehensive, competitive, and thoughtful total compensation package to our attorneys and staff, wherever they work. This compensation and benefits information is based on the Orrick’s estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors that may include, but not limited to, qualifications, relevant experience or education, particular skills or expertise, geography. Other compensation may include an annual discretionary merit bonus, which would be determined by Firm and individual performance. We offer a full range of elective health benefits including medical, dental, vision and life; robust mental well-being programs; child, family, elder, and pet care benefits; short- and long-term disability and industry leading parental leave benefits; health savings account contributions (w/applicable medical plan), flexible spending accounts, and a 401K program. This role will receive compensated time off through our Flexible Time Off program and paid holidays. Orrick accepts applications for this position on an ongoing basis, until filled. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Consistent with the SF Fair Chance Ordinance, an arrest and conviction record will not automatically disqualify a qualified applicant from consideration for employment. Weil seeks the best and brightest talent to join our Administrative Staff team. Our employees are the future of Weil so we invest in their training and development. Our environment embraces and encourages positive-minded professionals who seek to be challenged and acquire knowledge and skills in an atmosphere built on teamwork. Highly skilled and knowledgeable Administrative Staff assist our attorneys in successfully meeting and exceeding client needs and are vital to the overall success of the Firm. Job Description The Antitrust Practice Group Paralegal plays a vital role in our firm by collaborating closely with our attorneys and offering crucial support in connection with global M&A transactions and antitrust litigations on behalf of our antitrust clients. Specifically, this position will require involvement in all aspects of the global merger review process for large M&A transactions, including working with U.S. and international legal teams to provide guidance to clients on navigating the merger review process, assisting with the preparation of antitrust/regulatory filings, and helping to respond to regulator requests and/or engage in applicable legal proceedings. Primary Responsibilities and/or Essential Functions: Case Management Organize, update, and maintain client records relating to revenues, assets, subsidiaries/holdings, past transactions, and other corporate/financial information in an organized and easily accessible manner. Daily interaction with U.S. and international antitrust lawyers to provide relevant client information and data. Prepare, proof, and comply exhibits relating to U.S. HSR and global antitrust/merger control filings in order to obtain regulatory clearance for global M&A transactions. Perform regular audits to ensure client records and related data are up-to-date and organized. Review emails across multiple matters and proactively determine relevant follow ups or action items. Actively participate in both internal and external calls/meetings and subsequently deliver clear and concise notes summarizing the key discussion points and action items. Manage calendar and prepare agendas for team/client calls and other action items, as well as tracking when client materials need to be updated. Monitor and summarize news and press reports for updates and developments impacting clients. Understand and apply current information, technology, resources, methods and procedures necessary to perform assigned work. Provide support to other departments that depend on materials for both U.S. and global filings. Communicate clearly and concisely in written / verbal communications. Proactively communicates to facilitate workflow, teamwork and efficiency. Perform other tasks as assigned. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities A minimum of 2 years of paralegal experience. Highly motivated, proactive, and detail-oriented individual who will be readily available to provide assistance as needed. Ability to multi-task across a number of different matters and requests occurring in parallel. Manages and synthesizes a large volume of corporate/financial data and information. Analyzes problems, develops effective solutions and understands implications of proposed solutions. Makes appropriate and timely decisions. Proficiency/advanced ability with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Adobe, SharePoint, OneNote, Pacer Pro and Relativity. Produces high quality work; is efficient, accurate and has good attention to detail; consistently strives to improve performance; seeks opportunities to develop professionally and expand job knowledge. Displays high level of personal integrity. Works effectively with co-workers as part of the team to accomplish tasks. Flexible and open-minded, willing to share and exchange ideas/suggestions. Education/Certifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited 4-year college or university with strong academic record. Estimated salary range is $70,000-$80,000. Compensation decisions within the range are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case including but not limited to the individual’s skills, experience, and qualifications. Weil, Gotshal & Manges LLP offers a competitive compensation package comprised of base pay and discretionary year-end bonus for eligible employees. Benefits include, but are not limited to medical, dental, vision, disability coverage, life insurance, flexible spending plan and a 401K plan. Weil also offers generous paid time off and holidays. All decisions affecting employment at Weil, Gotshal & Manges LLP are made on the basis of qualification, performance and other pertinent work-related factors, and without discrimination against any person on the basis of race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran’s status, genetic information or any other legally protected status.

Job Title: Business Transactional Tax Attorney Any Office Location (#808)
Job Description:
The law firm of Baker, Donelson, Bearman, Caldwell & Berkowitz, P.C. seeks a shareholder or counsel-level Business Transactional Tax attorney to join its thriving Business Department. The ideal candidate should have at least 10 years of relevant corporate and transactional tax experience and serve as a trusted advisor for internal and external firm clients. For consideration, please click here.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

 	* Assist clients in structuring their financial transactions to optimize tax outcomes and ensure compliance with applicable tax laws and regulations.
 	* Provide guidance on the tax aspects of various matters including M&A, financing, private equity structures, capital markets transactions, and other business reorganizations.
 	* Negotiate and draft transactional documentation and agreements as well as prepare and issue tax opinions.
 	* Develop and maintain strong client relationships, serving as a trusted advisor.
 	* Collaborate with attorneys across practice groups and offices on complex tax matters.
 	* Serve as a mentor and leader to junior attorneys within the tax practice.

QUALIFICATIONS:

 	* Minimum of 10 years of experience in transactional tax matters with a proven ability to manage complex, tax-driven corporate transactions.
 	* Extensive knowledge of federal, state, and local tax laws.
 	* Strong understanding of partnership, corporate, and international tax issues.
 	* Expertise in specific areas like private equity, cross-border transactions, or real estate tax preferred.
 	* LL.M in Tax preferred.
 	* Admission to practice in the state where the attorney will be based.
 	* Strong communication, relationship-building and client service skills.

This position may be based at any office location within the Firm’s footprint. We will only contact those candidates who are selected for an interview.

Kirkland’s New York office is accepting applications from law clerks for litigation associate positions to start in 2025 and 2026. Clerks with a record of outstanding academic achievement and a desire to assume early responsibility will be considered. Law review, moot court, and other indicators of intellectual curiosity, teamwork, and drive are viewed favorably. Any applicant of interest will be contacted directly to schedule an interview. Please submit your resume and law school transcript. Kirkland & Ellis LLP offers a competitive salary structure, as well as a robust offering of benefits to all of its attorneys. Compensation is based upon the roles and responsibilities of the position and the experience and education of the applicant, and is aligned with internal pay equity within Kirkland & Ellis LLP itself. The hiring salary range for this position is between $215,000 and $250,000. These figures are not representative of the full compensation range for this position.

Job Description: Job Description: The Position Michael Best & Friedrich LLP is seeking a Mid-level Associate Attorney to join our best-in-class Employee Benefits and Executive Compensation group in any of our offices. The candidate should have at least three to five years of benefits experience in private practice. We are looking for someone with experience with qualified retirement plans, health & welfare plans, and executive & deferred compensation arrangements. Supporting benefits and compensation in M&A, ERISA litigation and withdrawal liability experience is a plus. Applicants must be detail oriented and possess excellent writing, oral advocacy, communication, and legal analysis skills. The associate should like to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Michael Best’s Employee Benefits and Executive Compensation group is regarded as one of the most sophisticated, full-service benefits practices, serving clients nationally and around the globe. Our group handles the complete spectrum of benefit and compensation issues and has advised on cutting edge benefits developments that have impacted national policy. Our clients include some of the most recognizable and iconic brands in the world. The Company This is an opportunity to work with the Best. We are Michael Best & Friedrich, LLP. We are a full-service law firm with more than 350 lawyers and technical professionals who work in collaborative, interdisciplinary practices to serve clients around the world. We work with companies in all kinds of industries, as well as trade associations, nonprofits, educational institutions, governments, family trusts, and high-net-worth individuals. Since our firm’s founding in 1848, we’ve continuously evolved to meet our clients’ changing needs and expectations. One thing remains the same: For generations, clients have relied on Michael Best for exceptional legal service and business acumen. The Location We have offices in Wisconsin (Milwaukee, Madison, Manitowoc, Waukesha); Illinois (Chicago); Utah (Salt Lake City); Colorado (Denver, Broomfield); Texas (Austin); North Carolina (Charlotte, Raleigh, Wilmington); California (Los Angeles); Nebraska (Lincoln) and Washington D.C. Our contemporary offices spaces are ideal for concentration and collaboration supporting our culture of working together to make great things happen for our clients. This position is located in any of our offices. Job Requirements: Bring Your Best Knowledge Base & Education: J.D. from an ABA accredited law school Excellent academic credentials At least three years of employment benefits experience in private practice Adaptability: Ability to learn and embrace new skills and best practices as the position evolves and Firm needs change Ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines Ability to work well independently as well as effectively within a team Collaboration: Ability to develop relationships and foster teamwork at all levels of the Firm Communication: Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with a diverse group of internal and external clients, attorneys, and staff Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to manage confidential information and sensitive situations with tact and discretion Problem Solving Skills: Ability and confidence to identify and analyze issues, make decisions, and initiate actions/solutions Agility to respond to unexpected challenges, including proactively developing innovative solutions to complex problems while maintaining a professional demeanor Professionalism: Ability to maintain composure and demonstrate good judgment Valid authorization to work in the U.S. Why You Should Apply At Michael Best, we are proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive Total Rewards package that provides a variety of resources designed to enhance its employees’ overall well-being, both at work and at home. Competitive base pay, outstanding benefits, opportunities for learning and growth, programs designed to help you plan for the future, and perks that inspire your downtime are all part of our total compensation package. Job Title: Traditional Labor Shareholder Any Office Location
Job Description:
The law firm of Baker, Donelson, Bearman, Caldwell & Berkowitz, P.C. seeks a shareholder-level attorney with significant experience in traditional labor law to join our nationally-recognized Labor & Employment practice. This is a unique opportunity to develop and lead the Firm’s traditional labor capabilities across industries and our geographic footprint. The ideal candidate is a seasoned practitioner with deep management-side labor experience, looking to build and grow a practice within a collaborative and entrepreneurial firm culture.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

 	* Advise employers on all aspects of traditional labor law, including union avoidance, union organizing, collective bargaining, grievance arbitration, labor strategy, and NLRB matters.
 	* Represent clients before the National Labor Relations Board and in labor arbitrations and negotiations.
 	* Manage and grow a strong book of business while fostering new client relationships.
 	* Collaborate with attorneys across practice groups and offices on complex labor and employment matters.
 	* Serve as a mentor and leader to junior attorneys within the labor & employment practice.

QUALIFICATIONS:

 	* Minimum of 10 years of experience in traditional labor law, with a demonstrated track record of success representing employers.
 	* Admission to practice in the state where the attorney will be based.
 	* Self-sustaining portable book of business required.
 	* Experience leading labor strategy and negotiations strongly preferred.
 	* Strong communication, relationship-building and client service skills.

This position may be based at any office location within the Firm’s footprint. We will only contact those candidates who are selected for an interview.

Job Location: Los Angeles, California; Orange County, California; San Francisco, California; Silicon Valley, California; Wilmington, Delaware; District of Columbia; Miami, Florida; Chicago, Illinois; Boston, Massachusetts; Kansas City, Missouri; North, New Jersey; New York City, New York; Charlotte, North Carolina; Raleigh, North Carolina; Portland, Oregon; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; South Carolina; Nashville, Tennessee; Austin, Texas; Dallas, Texas; Houston, Texas; Seattle, Washington
Job Description: Job Description At K&L Gates, we are looking for smart, imaginative and hard-working people with diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas to join us. Perhaps our search for talented visionaries and your search for important and impactful work lead to the same place. Position Summary The Practice Support Lawyer (PSL) is responsible for creating, maintaining and updating the knowledge and practice innovation assets and services for their assigned practice areas, as required by the relevant Practice Area Leader partners, Director of Practice Operations and Director of Practice Innovation (Director). Reporting to the Director, the PSL will provide support to their assigned practice areas and designated firmwide projects across a range of knowledge management (KM), innovation, generative AI, precedents, client growth, professional development and practice support initiatives. Essential Duties Practice Support Lawyers’ focus will vary depending on the needs of their practice areas. Core duties include: Develop, review and manage precedent and intellectual property for the practice area, which includes assisting practice lawyers and PSLs to organize and facilitate knowledge, precedents, and innovation forums and projects Apply, contribute to, and promote the development of a firmwide KM process to drive consistency, currency and excellence in precedents and knowledge assets and systems within (and across) the practice(s) Build close working relationships with partners, lawyers and allied professionals in the relevant practice areas; maintain a good understanding of the legal services provided by the practice areas and its clients/industries; be proactive in finding opportunities to increase efficiency through process improvement or the application of legal technology (including generative AI); and ensure knowledge, innovation and precedents services meet practice area needs Ensure compliance with firm policies, protocols and standards relevant to KM, data governance, and generative AI use, and that applicable policies and protocols are communicated in a clear and timely way Keep abreast of legal technology available at the firm to drive productivity, and help identify opportunities to apply solutions. Work with lawyers in the practice area to help identify use cases for AI or generative AI applications, agentic AI solutions, and automated workflow, including helping define, test, iterate and embed such solutions, both for the practice area and (where appropriate) client-facing solutions As required, provide support for document and workflow automation and collaboration projects including design, analysis, mapping, testing and training Collaborate with IT developers, data scientists, adoption and change management resources to help drive development and adoption of innovative practice solutions Drafting and editing precedents, guidance notes, checklists, client growth pitches and RFPs, training materials and presentations, legal updates and any other communications Use visual communication of legal advice and provide consultation to practice areas on visual standards, where appropriate Answer client growth and knowledge/innovation related enquiries from partners, lawyers and allied professionals, including Client Growth team members responding to client pitches and RFPs, and assist with the review and editing of pitch related materials for client proposals Communicate with the assigned practice areas on developments with KM resources, available legal technology solutions, and successful use cases Keep up to date with legal developments in relevant practice area and help advance practice innovation and professional development to reflect those advancements Assist with developing and delivering training on legal and practical knowledge and innovation topics Additional duties - may also include: Provide assistance to the Directors and other PSLs on compliance tasks as required by the Office of General Counsel, which may include researching, advising and training on global and national policies and professional practice standards Assist with facilitation of legal design sprints and hackathons and applying design thinking to legal problems Proactively identify, communicate, develop and implement new ways to improve KM and innovation services to K&L Gates, and promote opportunities for collaboration and innovation in delivering client services Participate in and contribute to (when requested) relevant global projects (multi regional or multi practice group) Participate in practice area meetings, Practice Innovation team meetings, PSL meetings and any relevant project meetings Record time if required on approved matters and projects Attend regular CLE/CPD sessions to maintain practicing certificate Maintain internal and external networks. Experience and Skills Required Qualified lawyer with at least 5+ years post admission experience - must have a valid practicing certificate for relevant jurisdiction Must have previously worked as a lawyer in private practice, specializing in Intellectual Property, and have maintained up to date legal knowledge in relevant practice area Knowledge Management, process improvement and change management experience or qualifications preferred (or willingness to develop skills in these areas) Excellent drafting skills and a demonstrated understanding of/commitment to plain language drafting and visual communication of legal advice Demonstrated experience with emerging legal technology, especially supporting/building/promoting AI and generative AI solutions, AI Agents, document and workflow automation, to assist the practice of law, is an advantage Ability to work independently with minimal supervision Excellent problem solving, time management and delegation skills; prepared to take on tasks delegated to you as needed Excellent communication (verbal and written) and influencing skills, including presentation, training and facilitation skills Good relationship building and interpersonal skills, able to work across multi-disciplinary teams to achieve collective outcomes; sensitive to global cultural and diversity issues Creative and collaborative approach to innovation; willingness to explore options for improvement; openness to productive change. Base Compensation $200,000 - $300,000 / year The compensation salary for this position will be determined during the interview process and will vary based on multiple factors, including but not limited to prior experience, relevant expertise, current business needs, and market factors. In accordance with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the California Fair Chance Act, qualified applicants for our Los Angeles and San Francisco offices with arrest and conviction records will be considered. ABOUT THE FIRM K&L Gates is a fully integrated global law firm with lawyers located across five continents in more than 40 offices. We have experienced dramatic growth in the past decade and now rank among the largest U.S. based law firms in the world. We take pride in constantly striving for innovation, imagination and an entrepreneurial spirit. We come up with big ideas and then roll up our sleeves to get the job done, guiding our clients through their most complex issues in a variety of industry sectors and across multiple regions of the world. The industry recognition the firm has garnered emanates from the foundation of a global community aligned on behalf of our clients. The people at K&L Gates are committed to working together to create a legacy for each other, the firm, our clients, and the communities in which we serve. We thrive in an inclusive and socially conscious environment that embraces diversity and takes a holistic approach to the career evolution of all our professionals. For more information or to view other job opportunities, please click here to go back to our careers page. Notice: We participate in E-Verify in certain Firm locations for purposes of verifying employment eligibility. It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability. BENEFITS K&L Gates offers our personnel a comprehensive suite of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time personnel include: Medical/Prescription Drug Coverage (including a Health Savings Account feature) Back-up Child/Elder Care and access to a caregiving concierge Dental Insurance Wellness Program Vision Insurance Pre-tax Commuting Benefits 401(k) Retirement Plan and Profit Sharing Business Travel Accident Insurance Short- and Long-term Disability Protection Pet Insurance Life Insurance (including Basic, Supplemental, Spouse, Child, and Accidental Death and Dismemberment) Health Advocacy Services Paid Time Off (25-30 days per year) Identity Protection/Restoration and Fraud Insurance Parental Leave (18 weeks of which 6 are paid; short-term disability may provide additional paid time off) Student loan refinancing options and access to a student loan concierge service Paid Holidays (12) Addiction Resources Family Building Benefits Breast Milk Delivery and Lactation Support Services Flexible Spending Accounts Employees also may be eligible to receive bonuses and certain expense reimbursements Employee Assistance Program Professional Development and CLE Credit Opportunities 529 Deductions Relocation Accident Insurance Employee Referral Program Critical Illness Insurance Hybrid/Remote Work Opportunities Hospital Indemnity Insurance Perks including: Technology, Entertainment, and Travel Discount Programs Bereavement Leave All other benefits (such as leaves of absence) required by law EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY The Firm is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the Firm that employment decisions shall be based on merit, qualifications and competence. Employment practices will not be influenced or affected by virtue of a person’s race (including traits associated with race, including hair texture and protective hairstyles such as afros, braids, locks, and twists), religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, gender, parental status, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, familial status, domestic violence victim status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy governs all aspects of employment including, without limitation, recruiting, hiring, compensation, benefits, promotion, assignment, and dismissal. In addition, it is the Firm’s policy to provide an environment that is free of prohibited harassment of any kind including, without limitation, that which is based on sex, race, age, disability, ethnic background, or any other category protected by law (including the categories listed above). The Firm complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact askHR@klgates.com.

Job Title: Real Estate Capital Markets Finance Associate
Job Description:
Job Description: 

Holland & Knight’s Real Estate Capital Markets practice is seeking a mid to senior-level associate to join its dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have experience representing clients in commercial real estate financing and investment matters, including representing lenders in the origination of mortgage loans and other types of structured debt, workouts of distressed commercial real estate loans, and other real estate transactions, such as purchases and sales of commercial property.

 Job Requirements: 

Excellent academic credentials are required and large regional, national, or international law firm experience is preferred. Holland & Knight possesses a collegial atmosphere and provides its professionals with a large platform with tangible opportunities for professional growth and advancement.

Apply through the portal and include your cover letter, resume, and transcript.

Job Requirements:

 	* 4-8 years of real estate finance experience. 
 	* Strong drafting, negotiation, and analytical skills.
 	* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 	* Strong academic credentials.

In accordance with the New York State Pay Transparency Law, New York City Human Rights Law, the Colorado Equal Pay Act, and the California Pay Transparency Law, the pay range for this position in New York State, New York City, Colorado, and California is $310,000 - $435,000max/yr. This range is specific to these locations and may not be applicable to other locations. An individual’s actual compensation will depend on the individual’s qualifications and experience.
